docs.lead_paragraph: A scandal-tainted minister’s apparent suicide threatened the chances that Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe’s ruling party can win a July upper house election.

headline.main: Abe Under Fire Over Suicide, Pension Mess

docs.lead_paragraph: Now that uranium prices have increased tenfold, the government has a precious commodity — and some tough questions — on its hands.

headline.main: Uranium Windfall Opens Choices for the Energy Dept.
headline.sub: Surplus Amassed When Prices Were Low;
headline.print_headline: Uranium Windfall Opens Choices for the Energy Dept.

docs.lead_paragraph: The presidential race was consumed last week with discussion of the immigration bill and financing of the Iraq war. This week, health care may take center stage, with Senator Barack Obama planning to release his long-awaited health care proposal today. Mr. Obama, the Illinois Democrat, will unveil his plan in the first caucus state, Iowa, and will outline how he wants to reduce the costs of health care and expand coverage to more people. He has already said that he would pay for his proposals by repealing President Bush's tax cuts for the wealthiest Americans.
docs.abstract: Observers say Michael Moore's forthcoming film Sicko, indictment of health care industry, could have impact on presidential campaign and give even more visibility to one of Americans' biggest concerns (M)
docs.snippet: The presidential race was consumed last week with discussion of the immigration bill and financing of the Iraq war. This week, health care may take center stage, with Senator Barack Obama planning to release his long-awaited health care proposal...
